question: In in vivo murine xenograft models, does siRNA-mediated knockdown of A20 accelerate tumor progression—such as increasing tumor growth or reducing survival—compared with controls? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: The tumorigenic potential of GSCs was decreased with A20 targeting, resulting in increased survival of mice bearing human glioma xenografts.
content.source_2: Selective siRNA-mediated knockdown of A20 in an orthotopic xenograft accelerated glioma progression, increasing tumor growth rates and shortening survival (HR = 1.9, p < 0.05).
content.source_3: CONCLUSIONS A20 was overexpressed both in human glioma tissues and cell lines, and inhibiting A20 expression greatly slowed tumor cell growth in culture and in mice.
content.source_4: In a mouse xenograft model, local delivery of A20-targeting siRNA failed to restrain tumors and was associated with faster solid tumor expansion and earlier endpoint criteria compared with control siRNA.
